chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on Mar 12, 1830, but died en route to post before his second commission was issued.
Not reaccredited under his new commission.

Officially recognized on Mar 16, 1837. Commissioned to Peru but received by the Government of the Peru-Bolivian Confederation. Returned to Peru but died at Callao, Jan 25, 1838, without resuming charge of the Legation.
Commissioned to the Peru-Bolivian Confederation, but received by the Government of Peru.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.

ended.note: Recall requested by the Government of Peru Apr 11, 1846 (request received, Jun 2, 1846); left post Jul 21, 1847
Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary
Notified the Government of Peru Oct 19, 1860, that relations were suspended; left post on or after Oct 27, 1860
Normal relations interrupted Nov 26, 1865; new Government of Peru still unrecognized by U.S. when Robinson left Peru Dec 21, 1865.

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jul 15, 1861.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 22, 1866.

ended.note: Presented recall on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 14, 1875.

ended.note: Normal relations interrupted Sep 28, 1881; Chilean occupation forces still in control of Lima when Hurlbut died at post Mar 27, 1882.

chief.note: Took oath of office and proceeded to post but did not present credentials; left Peru Mar 24, 1883.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 12, 1883.

ended.note: Normal relations interrupted Jul 18, 1962; new Government of Peru still unrecognized by U.S. when Loeb left post Jul 26, 1962

chief.note: Charles H. Brayshaw served as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim, Sep 1992-Dec 1993.
served as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim, Sep 1992-Dec 1993.
Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
